DOC.brief_title: Imaging Omics Cardiovascular Risk During NASA Deep Space Missions
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study develop new approach screen astronaut cardiovascular risk deep space mission . In protocol , two different form image used evaluate coronary plaque development ( CT coronary angiography ) microvascular function ( myocardial contrast echocardiography ) stratify CV risk . Based stratification , `` omic '' pattern ( target metabolomics , lipidomic , whole genome sequencing ) assess determine whether pattern add exist predictive model . Outcomes measure involve correlation `` omic '' pattern incremental risk scale low ( plaque normal endothelial function ) high ( + plaque endothelial dysfunction ) .
DOC.criteria: Patients refer clinically indicate CT coronary angiography within 6 month No obstructive coronary plaque Agatston score 0 At least one obstructive coronary plaque < 50 % diameter one high risk feature CTA ( positive remodeling , scattered calcification , low Hounsfield unit , `` napkin ring '' sign . Known CAD atherosclerotic disease Valvular heart disease ( moderate ) congenital heart disease Heart failure Pregnancy Allergy ultrasound contrast agent . Right leave shunt
